inlineContent.text: RIchTextKit supports changing styles (bold, italic, underline), font, font sizes, colors, alignment etc. You can also drag and copy in images if you use a data format that allows it.
RichTextKit is supported by and released with permission from
, which is out on iOS and soon on macOS.
RichTextKit can be installed with the Swift Package Manager:
The online documentation is currently iOS only. To generate documentation for other platforms, open the package in Xcode, select a simulator then run
Note that type extensions are not included in this documentation.
RichTextKit is available under the MIT license. See the [LICENSE][License] file for more info.

abstract.text: RichTextKit is a Swift-based library that lets you work with rich text in UIKit, AppKit and SwiftUI.
This enum represents errors that can be thrown when getting
rich text data for a certain format.
This enum specifies rich text formats that handle rich text
in different ways.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can present
a rich text and provide a
This struct can be used to configure how images are handled
in e.g. a
This share service can be used to generate a share file for
an attributed string with a certain format.
This picker can be used to pick a rich text alignment.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
a rich text string.
This export service can be used to export rich text content
to files with a certain format.
Get all available system fonts.
This protocol can be implemented by any classes that can be
used to share documents.
This struct defines a page configuration for a PDF document.
This sheet view provides different text format options, and
is meant to be used on iOS, where rich texts editor may not
have enough space to present all formatting.
This typealias represents a
keyed and
valued dictionary.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
additional image attachment capabilities.
This view can be used to list a collection of buttons for a
set of
values in a horizontal line.
This enum represents various rich text styles, such as bold,
italic and underlined.
This button can be used to toggle a
value.
This typealias bridges platform-specific fonts, to simplify
multi-platform support.
This struct can be used to style rich text highlighting.
This can be used to style a
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text alignment reading capabilities.
This sidebar view provides various text format options, and
is meant to be used on macOS, in a trailing sidebar.
This protocol can be implemented by types that can fetch an
image or multiple images from the pasteboard.
This struct is used by the various font pickers.
This enum defines errors that can be thrown when a file
manager fails to perform export operations.
This error can be thrown when creating PDF data from a rich
text string.
This context can be used to observe state for any rich text
view, as well as other editor-specific properties.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text data for its current attributed, rich text string.
RichTextKit is a Swift-based library that lets you work with rich text in UIKit, AppKit and SwiftUI.
This typealias bridges platform-specific symbolic traits to
simplify multi-platform support.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text color reading capabilities.
This view uses a plain
to list the provided fonts,
of which one can be selected.
This view lists a
and buttons to
increment and a decrement the font size.
This is a typealias for the
class, since it’s
the standard way to resolve export file urls.
This enum can be used to configure the image drop and paste
behavior of a
This is a platform-agnostic rich text view that can be used
in both UIKit and AppKit.
This SwiftUI text editor can be used to edit rich text with
an embedded
, a
as well
as a
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
or generate PDF data for the current rich text.
This font picker can be used to pick a font from a list. It
will by default use
fonts.
This enum simplifies working with different text alignments.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text font reading capabilities.
This typealias bridges platform-specific fonts, to simplify
multi-platform support.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text font writing capabilities.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text style writing capabilities.
This button can be used to trigger a predefined action.
This struct defines page margins for a PDF document.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
attributed string parsing of rich text-based data.
This protocol can be implemented by any type that should be
able to provide the standard rich text font size.
This view can be used to list a collection of toggles for a
set of
values in a horizontal line.
This button can be used to toggle a
value.
This typealias represents a rich text dictionary key.

with a
Get the currently selected range.
RichTextKit is a Swift-based library that lets you work with rich text in UIKit, AppKit and SwiftUI.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text alignment writing capabilities.
This typealias bridges platform-specific colors to simplify
multi-platform support.
This font picker uses a plain
to list provided fonts,
of which one can be selected.
This enum defines various ways to size images when they are
used in a rich text.
This enum defines rich text actions that can be executed on
a rich text editor.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text attribute reading capabilities.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text color writing capabilities.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text style for the current rich text font.
This custom attachment type inherits
and
aims to solve multi-platform image attachment problems.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
a writable rich text string.
This size picker uses a plain
to list the provided
font sizes, of which one can be selected.
This protocol can be implemented by any classes that can be
used to export rich text files.
This typealias bridges platform-specific font descriptors.
This toolbar can be added above the iOS keyboard to make it
easy to provide rich text formatting in a very compact form.
This keyboard toolbar menu can be used to solve a UI glitch
that can appear when adding a
to a keyboard toolbar.
This view can be used to list a collection of pickers for a
set of
values in a horizontal line.
This button can be used to select a certain color value. It
renders an appropriate icon next to the color picker.
This enum defines keyboard-specific, localized texts.
This protocol can be implemented by types that can generate
file urls, for instance when exporting rich text files.
This protocol can be implemented any types that can provide
rich text attribute writing capabilities.
This protocol defines a platform-agnostic api that’s shared
by the UIKit and AppKit
components.
